climbs.name: Another Cog
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Tally Reynolds, March 2016

content.description: Route variation from The Murder Machine, ascend right most open slab face above scary, broken cave with minimal gear which is the crux.
content.protection: Small trad rack, belay at top walk off to the west.
content.location: Start same as Murder Machine under roof but move immediately to right hand portion of roof and turn to face above.

climbs.name: You Die, She Dies, Everybody Dies
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Cabe Reynolds, May 2016

content.description: Nice clean slab face, with friction moves and finger jambs follows center of face with thin moves near top.
content.protection: Medium trad rack with small cams. Belay from top and scramble down to the east.
content.location: East most side of third coffin before broken chimney.  Just above "THE BEST BELAY SPOT EVER!".

climbs.name: Reapers Delight
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Tally Reynolds, May 2016

content.description: From the center of the crag climb straight up avoiding roofs to the right and a ridiculously rotton, scary cave to the left.  Scant gear placements are found on the route, use all you can, and consider equalized, multi-piece placements near the top. Better yet, skip this one altogether and climb other better lines.
content.location: Start at center of crag to the right of scary, rotten cave.

climbs.name: The Murder Machine
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Tally Reynolds, March 2016

content.description: Climb straight up middle of slab with good gear to summit.  Features roof over hang.
content.protection: Small trad rack.  Belay from top and walk off to west.
content.location: Start on grassy flat area under large roof.

climbs.name: Hells Staircase
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Cabe Reynolds, May 2016

content.description: Climb super clean slab turning three roofs on good holds.  Hidden holds at third roof makes for a pumpy crux.  Bolted face with belay/rap anchors.
content.location: Obvious stairsteps in middle of formation through 3 obvious roofs.

climbs.name: Creeping Death
climbs.fa: FA - Phil and Cabe Reynolds, Sept 2016

content.description: Same as Reapers Delight - don't bother with this one.
content.location: To the east of Reapers Delight.

climbs.name: Children of the Grave
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Tally Reynolds, March 2016

content.description: Easy and fun gear lead on left hand side of formation. Ascend two ledge and slab steps to clear open face and crux just before the summit.
content.protection: Small trad rack with nuts, belay from top and walk off to west.
content.location: Westerly most edge of crag where broken rock steps rise out of scree slope.

climbs.name: A Shallow Grave
climbs.fa: FA- Phil and Cabe Reynolds, May 2016

content.description: Route follows a right hand facing corner with fun hand jambs and broken cracks for gear.  Avoid moving too far onto the slab face to the right.  Brief crux at midway point has good gear placements.
content.location: Start on the low angle slabby face below broken corner to east of Staircase.  Follow corner to top.
